tool.name: @EXECUTABLE@
tool.description: Calculate distance between secondary structures of two RNAs
tool.command: RNAdistance < '$input' > '$outfile' --distance=#echo ''.join(str($distance).split(','))# --compare=$compare $shapiro $backtrack #if $backtrack and str($compare)=="m" && cat backtrack.file >> '$outfile' #end if

param.name: distance
param.label: Representation to calculate the distance / alignment option

validator.message: Please select at least one type.

param.name: compare
param.label: Comparison Option
param.option: m: matrix (each with each, output in matrix form)

param.label: Use cost matrix by Bruce Shapiro

tool.help:
**RNAdistance**
-----
**Input format**
RNAdistance requires one input file with the following structure: 1st line: can be a comment line like in Fasta, begins with '>' 2nd line: sequence 3rd line: first secondary structure in dot-bracket notation 4th line: second secondary structure in dot-bracket notation ... nth line: another sequence ...
Several different RNA secondary structures can be specified. The input has a Fasta-like structure but with secondary structure information.
------
**Outputs**
* distance of the structures * with the backtrack options it is possible to get alignment ouput
